comment.author: 18753752@N00
comment._content: Wonder how soon after the Titanic sank that this was conducted?

comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: the rings show this is the SS Rotterdam.  5 boats might indicate Rotterdam III, however her service dates were 1897-1906, so it is probably Rotterdam IV 1908-1940 which would mean 2 more boats would be to the right of the ones shown.

comment.author: 34876228@N04
comment._content: On closer inspection, the ring (flotation devices?) indicate the S.S. STATENDAM. Do you think that this is the correct ship? Could the following also be the Statendam? flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2787140790

comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: It's really difficult to say.  When I sharpen and enlarge this one it looks more like Rotterdam, when I do the other one it looks more like Statendam. Both ships are very similar is size and layout so it is probably impossible to say for sure, though I think it is most likely Statendam based on having 5 lifeboats in the photo and not 6.
